1499840991561453583.text: I'm proud to be a co-sponsor of this legislation, which will advance the health of our communities and our planet.

1499840987207806978.text: The Green New Deal for Public Housing Act - sponsored by @AOC - would expand federal programs to upgrade public housing infrastructure, making replacements and improvements for energy efficiency, building electrification, and water quality upgrades.

1499840984758247426.text: Creating sustainable infrastructure can play a key role in reducing emissions, creating jobs, and tackling the climate crisis. We have the opportunity to advance sustainable infrastructure across the country by building green public housing.

1499502647082201091.text: I was proud to vote for @RepCheri’s legislation to #EndForcedArbitration. Today @POTUS will sign this bill into law to void these agreements and give survivors the ability to tell their stories and achieve justice.

1499502645869953024.text:
60 million Americans have signed forced arbitration clauses at work, and many do so without even knowing.

Fine print hidden in a lengthy contract shouldn’t be what stops a sexual abuse survivor from getting their day in court.

1499497376330960901.text:
Thank you @JamaalBowmanNY for championing this critical legislation. 

I urge support for this bill and look forward to a House vote.

1499497374896607241.text:
As we emerge from the pandemic, our educators and our schools need support to ensure bright futures for our children and our planet. 

The Green New Deal for Public Schools Act provides an opportunity to bolster our education system while centering the needs of our environment.

1499497373487280138.text: The Green New Deal for Public Schools Act would also provide funding to hire thousands of additional educators and support staff - creating over 1.3 million jobs per year over the next ten years.

1499497371528568839.text: This legislation would make transformational investments to upgrade every public school in the country - including in our most marginalized communities - providing funds to construct new highly energy-efficient, zero-carbon schools, or convert existing facilities.

1499497369951510532.text:
To combat climate change, we must ensure that our infrastructure is sustainable and resilient, and our children should benefit from green infrastructure first and foremost.  

That's why I co-sponsored the Green New Deal for Public Schools Act, introduced by @JamaalBowmanNY.

1499444759974354948.text:
This piece of legislation is a commonsense step to support flexibility for ranchers, promote smart land-use practices, and importantly, to advance the mission of conserving and restoring our lands, waters, and wildlife. 

My full statement:
https://t.co/vW7Nq1qsdc

1499444758854389769.text: Today, @RepHuffman and I introduced the Voluntary Grazing Permit Retirement Act, which would give grazing permit holders the flexibility to voluntarily waive their grazing permits on Federal lands for equitable compensation.

1499444757654822914.text: Ranchers across the country face increasing costs and land management challenges, and are in need of expanded flexibility with their grazing permits to make the best decisions for their land and their families.

1497289125795348488.text:
No one should face discrimination because of who they are or who they love. Period. 
  
After a year of inaction, I urge the Senate to vote on this crucial piece of legislation to advance the civil rights of LGBTQ+ individuals across America.

1497289123085750273.text: Anti-LGBTQ+ legislation has been introduced in several states, making it more important than ever that we safeguard the rights and freedoms of LGBTQ+ Americans who deserve the opportunity to pursue full and prosperous lives.

1497289120816709632.text: Today marks one year since the House passed the Equality Act, a historic bill that would amend the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to extend vital non-discrimination protections to members of the LGBTQ+ community.

1497262705299927052.text: I am proud to be an original cosponsor of the Anti-Racism is Public Health Act, which would create a National Center for Anti-Racism and develop a Law Enforcement Violence Prevention Program at the @CDCgov, so that we can confront the health impacts of structural racism. (3/3)

1497262703898939395.text: Case in point: Black Americans have suffered disproportionately more during the COVID-19 pandemic. Black communities have experienced higher rates of hospitalization and death and are more often underinsured or have no health insurance at all. (2/3)

1497262702267445248.text:
Systemic racism is a public health crisis.  

Black Americans have unequal access to quality, affordable healthcare, and as a result, Black communities face disparate health impacts. (1/3)

1497252771061456899.text:
Today @POTUS makes history by nominating the first Black woman to the Court.
 
Congratulations, Judge Jackson on this incredible achievement. I look forward to your confirmation & watching as you protect the rights & freedoms of the American people & the will of our Constitution.

1497252769836720133.text: With each of these nominations, Judge Jackson was confirmed with strong bipartisan support because of her broad set of experiences, her diverse legal perspective, and her unwavering commitment to equal justice under the law.

1497252768733700101.text: In 2009, President Obama nominated her to serve as Vice Chair of the U.S. Sentencing Commission and then in 2012 as a district judge for the U.S. District Court for D.C. In 2021, she was nominated by President Biden to serve on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit.

1497252767093727232.text: Judge Jackson spent years as a public defender, and will become the first former federal public defender to serve on the Supreme Court.

1497252765864714243.text: Judge Jackson will be an exceptional addition to the Court, bringing her impressive credentials – having graduated cum laude from Harvard Law School – and her immense qualifications from years of experience in public service.

1497252764510003205.text: Today, @POTUS nominated one our country's brightest legal minds, Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, to serve on the United States Supreme Court.

1488234388504682496.text: Aviation noise and emissions have disproportionately affected low-income communities and communities of color. As such, we must treat these issues as a matter of environmental justice and health equity. (2/4)

1488234387036643333.text: For far too long, residents living near airports and airflight pathways - like my constituents in the 9th district - have been left to deal with the harm caused by aviation noise and emissions pollution without robust federal support. (1/4)

Senate Republicans have used the filibuster to obstruct voting rights legislation for too long.

I stand with Democrats in our fight for voting rights legislation and I urge my colleagues in the Senate to do whatever it takes to get these bills across the finish line. (4/4)

1481669608939696129.text:
Our democracy is built on the sacred principle that every American has the fundamental right to vote.

The Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act will ensure that every American has equal freedom to make their voice heard in our democracy and secure our election system. (3/4)

1481669607412883458.text:
In 2021, state lawmakers across the country introduced over 440 voter suppression bills.

This is a critical moment for our democracy. The Senate must pass voting rights legislation - even if that means changing the rules in the Senate and reforming the filibuster. (2/4)

@POTUS has made it clear: now is the time for Congress to pass voting rights legislation to restore and safeguard voting rights nationwide. (1/4)

Happy New Year! As we enter 2022, I am looking forward to all that we will accomplish as a nation in the new year.  

I wish everyone in the 9th District - and across the country - a year of health and happiness.

1477057743689244675.text:
While we experienced some hardships this year, we also experienced some great accomplishments.  

As we enter 2022, I am looking forward to taking on the new year together.  

Happy New Year's Eve! (3/3)

1477057739910230022.text: With the passage of the American Rescue Plan, we helped vaccinate millions of Americans and spur our economic recovery. We also passed the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, which will repair America's outdated infrastructure and invest in our competitiveness and resiliency. (2/3)

1477057735627882496.text:
As we prepare to leave 2021 behind, it is important that we reflect on the past year. 2021 has been hard for many of us - the COVID-19 pandemic wore on and communities across the country saw the worsening effects of climate change.

But we still have a lot to be proud of. (1/3)

1476974002153345029.text: In this time of crisis, Congress has delivered. We will continue to work hard to ensure that you and your family remain safe and healthy. (3/3)

1476973999544586240.text: We've gotten 490 million shots in arms. According to the White House, that means that we've saved 1.1 million American lives & prevented 10.3 million hospitalizations. (2/3)

1476973996969234432.text:
We should be proud of the work that we have done in 2021 to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. 

Thanks to the nationwide vaccination program - funded by the American Rescue Plan - more than 71% of American adults are fully vaccinated and 85% of adults have had their first shot. (1/3)

(2/3)

1476636777159049222.text: Despite the era of partisan gridlock that we find ourselves in, this year Congress was able to pass the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, which makes significant investments in America's infrastructure and competitiveness. (1/3)

1471925707584557059.text: The U.S. must uphold the right to reproductive health care in our own country and around the globe. People everywhere should have access to safe and legal abortion so they can make informed decisions about their own bodies that allow them to lead full and healthy lives. (4/4)

1471925705906741257.text: That’s why I co-sponsored the #AbortionisHealthcareEverywhereAct, which would repeal the Helms Amendment and allow the U.S. to provide comprehensive reproductive health care services and equipment to foreign countries. (3/4)

1471925704342360069.text:
In effect, this amendment blocks aid to organizations overseas that perform, advocate, or even direct people to abortion care. It denies millions of people the health care they want and need.

On the 48th anniversary of this outdated policy, it's past time to #RepealHelms. (2/4)

1471925702572351498.text: For decades, the U.S. has denied abortion care for millions worldwide through the #HelmsAmendment, which was signed into law as part of the Foreign Assistance Act in 1973 and prohibits the use of any U.S. foreign assistance funds for abortion services. (1/4)

As state legislatures across the country work to undermine abortion care access, our fight continues. 
 
But for now we can celebrate a significant win: Yesterday's decision will make abortion care significantly more equitable and accessible. 6/6

The #BuildBackBetterAct is the best way to lower energy costs for millions of American families.  

The bill includes $300 billion in clean energy tax cuts to relieve consumers from the volatility of fossil fuel prices and to ensure access to reliable, affordable, clean energy.

1470461076458323970.text:
These actions will support a growing fleet of electrified vehicles and bolster our existing network of EV charging stations - reducing our reliance on fossil fuels.

(3/5)

1470461070984757251.text: The plan will focus on building a convenient and reliable public charging network across the country, paying special attention to rural, disadvantaged, and hard-to-reach communities. (2/5)

Now, our focus must be threefold:

1432789059961827330.text: @POTUS made the right decision to end our military involvement in Afghanistan, and our service members ensured more than 120,000 U.S. citizens, citizens of our allies, and our Afghan allies were transported safely — the largest airlift operation in U.S. history.

1432789058904858633.text:
Our initial mission in Afghanistan – to hold those who planned 9/11 accountable and prevent a similar attack on the homeland – was successful.

But over time, that mission grew too broad as we tried to help create an Afghan government that could provide for its own security.

1432789057470451712.text:
Our deepest condolences go out to the families of the 13 service members who gave their lives in support of this withdrawal effort.

They represent the best of our country, and their sacrifice will not be forgotten.

1432789055570419719.text:
Thanks to President Biden’s leadership — and the sacrifices of our men and women in uniform — our military engagement in #Afghanistan has finally come to an end.

1308472564013031425.text: Rather than using the bulk of this $1B to bolster medical supply production, the Pentagon directed more than $650M to the Defense Industrial Base. As Chair of @HASCDemocrats I do not take our national security lightly, but conventional weapons will not protect us from the virus.

1308472563144839168.text: The American people deserve answers. With the flu season rapidly approaching, what is the administration’s plan to ensure frontline workers and health care professionals have reliable access to the PPE and medical supplies they so desperately need?

1308472562310090759.text: The CARES Act provided the Pentagon with $1B to help bolster the country’s supply of medical equipment. Today, five months later, we still face shortages of N95 masks and other key medical supplies and equipment, while hundreds of Americans lose their lives to the virus each day.

1308472561311846401.text:
You can read the full letter, which I sent with my colleagues and fellow Chairs @RepMaxineWaters, @RepEliotEngel, @BennieGThompson, and @FrankPallone, here:

1204916282472181760.text:
The passage of the NDAA is crucial to our collective national security, and today’s vote is the culmination of months of hard work for the American people and the brave women and men who serve our nation in the armed services.

Read my full statement here: https://t.co/chJVVZYfGw

1204859569710735361.text: And make no mistake about it, I will continue to fight for the provisions we did not get, hopefully at some point with a Senate and President who better reflect the values of our country. I know how important these provisions are. 14/14

1204859568733523968.text: I am proud that this bill will better provide for the widows and families of those service members who have made the ultimate sacrifice for our country. And I am proud that this bill reflects Democratic priorities and American values. 13/14

1204859567932354565.text: That is why I so am proud of this bill – because of everything that is contained in its 1,249 individual provisions and more than 4,000 pages. I am proud that this bill will change the lives of millions by providing paid parental leave. 12/14

1204859567034769408.text: Leader McConnell and Chairman Inhofe would have been thrilled to pass a ‘skinny NDAA’ with zero Democratic priorities. That alternative would have none of the key policies we fought so hard for – no paid parental leave, no “widow’s tax” repeal, and nothing to address PFAS. 11/14

1204859566221070337.text: President Trump, Leader McConnell, and Chairman Inhofe would have killed the bill over these provisions. If we kill the bill, we would have gotten nothing. Not a single Democratic priority. 10/14

1204859565289984000.text: To those who say that we should have ‘fought harder’ or ‘held the line’ – I can assure you we fought the entire time until the very end. 9/14

1204859564241362945.text: To those who say that this bill isn’t enough – I could not disagree more. When I look at the widows, the parents, families who will benefit from the bill, it is enough. We are delivering more for families across this country than anyone even conceived of going into this year.8/14

1204859563272474624.text: Nonetheless, we have accomplished more with this bill than anyone ever thought possible given the realities of a Trump White House and a Republican-controlled Senate, and we should be proud of that. 7/14

1204859562148405251.text: Throughout the negotiations I failed in one way: I was unable to turn President Trump, Leader McConnell, and Chairman Inhofe into Democrats and convince them to suddenly accept all of the provisions they despise. 6/14

1204859560730730498.text: Do you know what they also hated? The repeal of the ‘widow’s tax’ and granting paid parental leave for fed employees. But, because of our tireless work, we succeeded in getting these provisions and our bill will have real impacts on Americans leading real lives. 5/14

1204859559812186112.text: From the moment we passed our bill through the House without the support of a single Republican vote, it was clear that our counterparts in the Senate and White House fundamentally opposed the Democratic priorities included in the bill. 4/14

1204859558931423233.text: To those detractors I ask one simple question: Which of the provisions that did not make it into our final bill did President Trump, Leader McConnell, and Chairman Inhofe not hate? 3/14

1204859557618606080.text: After months of hard-fought negotiations, our bill is now final. It contains major wins for Democrats and working people and promotes our national security. Despite this sweeping success, some have decried the bill, saying it fails to live up to progressive values. 2/14

1204859556452536320.text: Before my colleagues and I cast our votes on the FY20 NDAA, one thing must be made clear: This is the most progressive defense bill we have passed in decades. 1/14

1113836376489910272.text: The United States must be squarely focused on using its leverage to reinforce the UN Special Envoy’s efforts towards a peaceful resolution and to take steps to alleviate the devastating effects of this conflict on the Yemeni people.

1113836375776874499.text: The situation remains on extremely fragile ground – failed progress in the peace process and any escalation in violence risks worsening the food insecurity, cholera outbreak, and displacement already plaguing the country.
